profileAlternative.name: Anuj Katiyal
profileAlternative.headline: Data Scientist at Conde Nast • MS in Data Science, Columbia University • IIIT-H Alumnus • Marathoner
profileAlternative.summary:
I have been working as a full stack ML engineer at Condé Nast after having graduated from Columbia University with Masters in Data Science. My CS background and the gained skills in the fields related to Statistical Inference and Modeling, Data Visualization as well as Machine Learning have helped me become a full stack ML engineer and I have been able to tackle end to end ML projects in the industry. For example, I have been successfully able to scale a project to predict virality for content published by Condé Nast to all the brands and the project has nearly doubled the traffic on the brands.

In particular, I have strong quantitative skills from my mathematics background and experience with data mining and analysis, mainly in Python. I also enjoy working on web and mobile development and learning the latest tools and technologies. I have been doing MOOCs, mainly courses on fast.ai and Udemy, to keep up with the state of the art techniques in NLP and Deep Learning.

I try and gain the data science skills with undivided Focus and Consistency, giving proper Significance to learning and being Restorative towards the issues faced along the way, trying always to be deliberative towards my career goals. Deliberative, Significance, Consistency, Restorative, Focus - these aren’t just words for me, these are my superpowers. My learning experiences, marathon adventures and quantified self enthusiasm are perfectly captured by them.

educations.title: Columbia University in the City of New York
International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad
educations.degree: Bachelor of Technology (Hons) + M.S. by Research

given.text: This was my first job and I got to work with the best boss who guided me throughout my journey with her in the company. She is very patient with everyone and gives them time for whatever they want to do. She made me follow a proper step-by-step procedure for learning which helped me being better in the field I used to work in and I would love to comeback, interact and work with her after my research. See less

items: Complaints about Traffic conditions in the city of Boston : Text Classification and Clustering Analysis
Machine Learning for Data Science (COMS 4721) : Projects
Quantified Self : Analyzing Personal Garmin Data (2012-2017)
In-Class Kaggle : Bank's Marketing Campaign to Analyze Subscription Status (Classification Analysis)
Predicting Market Rate for Apartments based on New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (NYCHVS) : Regression Analysis
Data Visualization Project : Marvel vs DC Superheroes compared using D3.js
I Know What You Coded Last Summer: Mining Candidate Expertise from GitHub Repositories
An Unmixing Framework to improve class accuracies using detected High Importance Local Regions
Improving Utility of Low-Resolution data using Statistical approaches in Remote Sensing
Spatio-Spectral method for Estimating classified regions with high confidence using Modis Data
